results.title: On the side of the angels
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, Claire Jaeger and Peter Kaufmann
results.brief_description:
This film presents the story of the people involved in the
movement for peace in Australia from 1900 to the present. Using rare archival film, the program reflects on the international events that concerned and influenced many people to organise together for peace and world stability. Features Ralph Gibson, founding member against war and fascism in the 30s, Stephen Murray-Smith, peace historian, Sam Goldbloom, Council for International Cooperation and Disarmament, Jim Cairns, Deputy Prime Minister with the Whitlam government, Jean McLean, radical Victorian Labour MP and Jo Camilleri, Convenor of People for Nuclear Disarmament.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Open Channel Productions, Claire Jaeger and Peter Kaufmann

results.title: On the run
results.creator_credit: Sparky Greene, Everard Films and Titan Films
results.brief_description: Filmed in New Zealand, features running trainer Arthur Lydiard and the world competition runners who use his program, as they comment about long-distance mountain running and its resulting increase in their stamina and the pleasures of roaming over the varied terrain.

results.title: On the run
results.creator_credit: Pat Jackson, Derek Williams and C F F Productions
results.brief_description: A girl runs away from a welfare worker and encounters two boys. One of the boys is the son of an ousted African leader. When the girl overhears a plot by the leader’s treacherous brother to kidnap the leader’s son, she rescues him with the aid of the other boy and the trio go on the run pursued by the leader’s brother and his henchman. Stars Gordon Jackson, Denis Conoley, Robert Kennedy and Tracy Collins. Based on the book by Nina Bawden; script by Pat Jackson; camera by Stephen Dade; music by William Davies.

results.title: On the road with Circus Oz
results.creator_credit: Zbigniew Friedrich, Don McLennan and Ukiyo Films
results.brief_description: Follows the members of Circus Oz on a six week country tour. Performances and rehearsals are juxtaposed with interviews and scenes of the back-breaking effort that goes into keeping the show on the road. Reveals the performers as being dedicated to their skills, and commited to a philosophy which precludes any hierarchical structure or discrimination on the grounds of sex or ability. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: On the Road to Survival
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
Survival, says Jack Absalom, is a matter of commonsense and preparedness. In this film he demonstrates the techniques for safe travel that he has developed in his many years in the Outback. The program recreates a simple vehicle breakdown and highlights the potential for a tragedy. Rated: PG

results.title: On the road again
results.creator_credit: Bill Medlyn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1942, Bill joined the army, taking his brothers place who returned home to work on the farm. Bill worked in many capacities as a driver and instructor. Having a severe driving accident on a mission, Bill landed in hospital for three months with a fractured spine. Making a good recovery, he was able to return to service.

results.title: On the river: Thailand
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows the lifestyle of one Thai family on a large riverboat in Thailand. Also indicates the role of the river as a highway and the human habitation along the riverside. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: On the Right Track
results.brief_description: A Department of Conservation, Forests and Lands Program. Examines the Code of Forest Practices which was set to ensure careful logging use of our valuable forests to protect them for future generations.
